Author: hwork
Content: Yeah, I like that: 'Constant Gratification'.  I think that is in essence what keeps coders going.

Author: mattmaroon
Content: I'd need about two mil to retire comfortably I'd say. It's far easier to get to that from one million than it is to get to one million from $5,000. Hence I'd be seriously screwed, especially at that age, If I found myself with $950k and had to lose it all, whereas had I not made the bet, I'd probably be at most 5 years from retirement.

Author: charzom
Title: Why Google Turned Into a Social Butterfly

Author: charzom
Title: The Man Behind the Google Phone

Author: pg
Content:
the people who are telling you to go off on your own are also financially interested in the phenomenon of selling teams of young engineers to big companies

I can't believe people still write stuff like this. Doesn't anyone stop to think how little investors make when that happens, compared to the returns if a startup keeps going?
